snippet: Britain’s chancellor of the Exchequer was teased by his Czech counterpart as Europe’s finance ministers failed to reach an accord on the amount of capital reserves required for banks.
abstract: Europe’s finance ministers fail to reach an accord on the amount of capital reserves required for banks; Britain stands mostly alone after refusing to give its blessing to the deal.
lead_paragraph: Britain’s chancellor of the Exchequer was teased by his Czech counterpart as Europe’s finance ministers failed to reach an accord on the amount of capital reserves required for banks.

headline.main: Britain Remains a Dissenter as Europeans Try to Set Capital Reserves for Banks
headline.print_headline: Britain Remains a Dissenter as Europeans Try to Set Capital Reserves for Banks
